net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.content.querybuilder

Class QueryBuilder<I extends QueryBuilder,R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.content.querybuilder.QueryBuilder<I,R>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - The implementation class which extends QueryBuilder. This is set explicitly in the declaration of the implementation class, and allows the superclass to provide concrete implementations of methods reusable by the descendants.
    R - The return type of the execute() method, which corresponds to a method in ContentResolver.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DeletionBuilder, InsertionBuilder, MockQueryBuilder, SelectionBuilder, UpdateBuilder

    public abstract class QueryBuilder<I extends QueryBuilder,R>
extends java.lang.Object
    Builds a ContentResolver query using builder-style methods, rather than the standard methods, which use long lists of often-null parameters.

    This class is supposed to do very little; the consumer should use the static methods insertInto(android.content.ContentResolver, android.net.Uri), update(), selectFrom(android.content.ContentResolver, android.net.Uri), and deleteFrom(android.content.ContentResolver, android.net.Uri) to spawn instances of the various implementation classes corresponding to query actions.

    Since:
    zerobandwidth-net/android 0.1.7 (#39)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  QueryBuilder.ExecutionException
      Exception thrown by execute() and executeOn(android.content.ContentResolver, android.net.Uri) when the underlying ContentResolver query operation fails.
      static class  QueryBuilder.UnboundException
      Informs a consumer of QueryBuilder that it has tried to invoke the execute() method without first binding to a data source.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.lang.String[] m_asExplicitWhereParams
      A substitute, explicit list of "where" parameters, to fit the format string stored in m_sExplicitWhereFormat.
      protected android.content.ContentResolver m_rslv
      The ContentResolver to which the builder is bound.
      protected java.lang.String m_sExplicitWhereFormat
      A substitute, explicit "where" format string, for which m_asExplicitWhereParams provides the values.
      protected android.net.Uri m_uri
      The Uri to be supplied to the ContentResolver.
      protected android.content.ContentValues m_valsToWrite
      For "insert" and "update" operations, these are the values to be written.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      QueryBuilder()
      The default constructor; does not bind to a particular data source.

      A shared constructor which binds the builder to a specific resolver and URI.
      QueryBuilder(android.content.Context ctx, android.net.Uri uri)
      A shared constructor which binds the builder to a the resolver found in the given context, and the specified URI.

        public QueryBuilder(android.content.Context ctx,
                    android.net.Uri uri)
             throws QueryBuilder.UnboundException
        A shared constructor which binds the builder to a the resolver found in the given context, and the specified URI.
        Parameters:
        ctx - a context which can provide a ContentResolver
        uri - the URI at which the query should be executed
        Throws:
        QueryBuilder.UnboundException - if either parameter is unusable

        uri - the URI at which the query should be executed
        Throws:
        QueryBuilder.UnboundException - if either parameter is unusable

    • Method Detail

      • insert

        public static InsertionBuilder insert()
        Kicks off construction of an insertion query. When constructing the builder in this way, the caller must also call onDataSource(android.content.ContentResolver, android.net.Uri), or use executeOn(android.content.ContentResolver, android.net.Uri) instead of execute().
        Returns:
        an instance of the builder that handles insertion queries

      • insertInto

        public static InsertionBuilder insertInto(android.content.ContentResolver rslv,
                                          android.net.Uri uri)
                                   throws QueryBuilder.UnboundException
        Kicks off construction of an insertion query.
        Parameters:
        rslv - the resolver through which the query should be executed
        uri - the URI at which the query should be executed
        Returns:
        an instance of the builder that handles insertion queries
        Throws:
        QueryBuilder.UnboundException - if the data context is unusable

      • where

        public I where(java.lang.String sWhereClause)
        Constructs an explicit "where" clause for a query.

        The supplied string is used as-is in the underlying ContentResolver query function, and should contain only necessary columns with literal values (no variable substitutions). Based on this restriction, the collection of variable substitution sources will be set as null.

        Parameters:
        sWhereClause - the explicit "where" clause, containing only literal values
        Returns:
        (fluid)

      • where

        public I where(java.lang.String sWhereFormat,
               java.lang.String... asWhereParams)
        Sets the "where" clause format and values for a query.
        Parameters:
        sWhereFormat - the format string of the "where" clause, which must use ? for parameter substitution
        asWhereParams - the parameters for the "where" clause, assigned to substitution markers in the format string
        Returns:
        (fluid)
        See Also:
        ContentUtils.QUERY_VARIABLE_MARKER

      • where

        public I where(java.lang.String sWhereFormat,
               java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> asWhereParams)
        Sets the "where" clause format and values for a query.
        Parameters:
        sWhereFormat - the format string of the "where" clause, which must use ? for parameter substitution
        asWhereParams - the parameters for the "where" clause, assigned to substitution markers in the format string
        Returns:
        (fluid)
        See Also:
        ContentUtils.QUERY_VARIABLE_MARKER

      • getWhereFormat

        protected java.lang.String getWhereFormat()
        Creates the Android "where" clause format string to be passed to a ContentResolver query method.
        Returns:
        the "where" clause format string

      • getWhereParams

        protected java.lang.String[] getWhereParams()
        Creates the array of "where" clause value substitutions to be passed to a ContentResolver query method.
        Returns:
        the "where" clause format string's parameters

      • execute

        public final R execute()
                throws QueryBuilder.UnboundException,
                       QueryBuilder.ExecutionException
        Executes the query that has been built by the implementation class, using the ContentResolver and Uri to which the builder has been bound, either by the constructor, or by an invocation of onDataSource(android.content.ContentResolver, android.net.Uri).
        Returns:
        the return type appropriate to the query action
        Throws:
        QueryBuilder.UnboundException
        QueryBuilder.ExecutionException

      • executeOn

        public final R executeOn(android.content.ContentResolver rslv,
                         android.net.Uri uri)
                  throws QueryBuilder.UnboundException,
                         QueryBuilder.ExecutionException
        Executes the query that has been built by the implementation class, using the supplied ContentResolver and Uri. Usually, this is not invoked directly, but is instead consumed by execute().
        Parameters:
        rslv - the resolver through which the query should be executed
        uri - the URI at which the query should be executed
        Returns:
        the return type appropriate to the query action
        Throws:
        QueryBuilder.UnboundException - if the data context binding is inadequate
        QueryBuilder.ExecutionException - if the underlying query fails

      • executeOn

        public final R executeOn(android.content.Context ctx,
                         android.net.Uri uri)
                  throws QueryBuilder.UnboundException,
                         QueryBuilder.ExecutionException
        Executes the query that has been built by the implementation class, using the ContentResolver provided by the specified Context, and the specified Uri.
        Parameters:
        ctx - a context which can provide a ContentResolver
        uri - the URI at which the query should be executed
        Returns:
        the return type appropriate to the query action
        Throws:
        QueryBuilder.UnboundException - if the data context binding is inadequate
        QueryBuilder.ExecutionException - if the underlying query fails

      • executeQuery

        protected abstract R executeQuery(android.content.ContentResolver rslv,
                                  android.net.Uri uri)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Consumed by execute() and executeOn(android.content.ContentResolver, android.net.Uri) to actually carry out the operation. In the implementation class, this method should consist solely of the ContentResolver query method call, plus any other pre-checks which might be able to short-circuit the query execution.
        Parameters:
        rslv - the resolver through which the query should be executed
        uri - the URI at which the query should be executed
        Returns:
        the return type appropriate to the query action
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if anything goes wrong
